COMMENT_TX: Bancroft took Frederick's relay and threw wildly to 3B

E. Clark crashed heavily against the tin fence in front of CF bleachers.  After throwing the ball to the infield he fell to the ground and remained motionless.  He was carried off the field on a stretcher and appeared to be unconscious. His neck was badly injured and X-rays were to be made to determine if his neck was broken. After the game it was reported Clark sustained a slight concussion of the brain and he remained in a coma for more than a half hour.  X-rays did not reveal any fractures in his neck or shoulder.

ej,everj102,C,quige901,Batting out of turn argument $Dugan (still batting out of turn) led off with a single to left. Ott fell away from an inside pitch and the Braves declared he had swung at the ball for strike three.  HP Ump Hart refused to allow the claim, and Magerkurth at 1B also said Ott had not swung, but Ump Moran said he had, whereupon Hart reversed himself and called Ott out.
